benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Retrieve an account emails

covered: Valid Request: TC01 verifies successful retrieval with status 200, application/json Content-Type, and presence of expected AccountEmail fields
Empty Response: TC02 and TC04 validate that accounts with no emails or non existent accounts return an empty JSON array with 200
Invalid accountId format: TC03 verifies that a malformed accountId returns 400
Extra Query Parameters: TC07 confirms extra parameters are ignored and do not alter results
Authorization presence: TC05 checks missing/invalid authentication returns 401 or 403 (if auth is required)
Service Unavailability: TC06 covers handling of an unavailable API returning 503
Large dataset handling: TC08 tests retrieval of 1000+ emails and includes a response time expectation
Concurrency: TC13 addresses behavior under multiple simultaneous requests
Security: TC10 and TC11 cover SQL injection and XSS attempts in the accountId path parameter
Special characters: TC12 ensures emails with unicode and special characters are returned correctly
Transient failures/resilience: TC09 addresses client retry/timeout behavior for transient network failures
Backward compatibility: TC14 checks legacy client compatibility for response format
Accessibility: TC15 covers clarity and machine readable error messages and documentation
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination parameters (limit/offset/page), Link headers, or partial result handling for large datasets
Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling behavior or 429 responses and Retry-After header under high request rates
Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified, or conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match -> 304)
Full Schema Validation: Tests check presence of sample fields but do not validate the complete AccountEmail schema, types, required fields, or extra unexpected fields
Authorization Scope and Access Control: TC05 covers unauthenticated access but there are no tests for authenticated users lacking permission to view an account (authorization/ACL scenarios)
Server Error Handling: No explicit tests for 500 Internal Server Error or ensuring sanitized error responses and logging behavior
Content Negotiation and Headers: No tests for Accept header variations, character encoding, or other response headers beyond Content-Type
URL Encoding and Path Edge Cases: Missing tests for encoded accountId, trailing slash behavior, missing accountId path segment, or whitespace-padded accountId values
Ordering / Deduplication: No tests verify ordering of returned emails, stable sort behavior, or duplicate entry handling
Pagination + Performance: Large dataset test exists but pagination performance and behavior under paging is not tested
recommendations: Add pagination tests covering limit/offset or page parameters, validate paging headers (Link, total count if provided), and test edge pages and empty page results
Implement rate limiting tests that simulate burst traffic to assert 429 responses, presence of Retry-After header, and graceful client behavior
Add caching tests to verify ETag and Cache-Control headers and conditional GETs (If-None-Match) returning 304 when appropriate
Introduce full JSON schema validation for AccountEmail objects (validate field types, required fields, formats and absence of sensitive fields)
Add authorization/ACL tests for authenticated users without access to the target account to ensure 403 responses where appropriate
Simulate server errors (500) to verify sanitized error messages and ensure the API does not leak internal stack traces or implementation details
Test content negotiation and response headers beyond Content-Type (Accept header handling, charset, etc.)
Add edge case tests for URL/path handling: percent-encoded accountId, trailing slash, missing accountId, and whitespace or very long accountId values
Add tests for ordering and deduplication guarantees if the API makes ordering or uniqueness promises
Combine pagination and performance testing: measure latency and throughput when fetching paged results from very large datasets and under concurrency
